intro: Siphoneranthemum exaequatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy texture and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Siphoneranthemum exaequatum requires well-draining soil and moderate watering to prevent root rot.
